resources.string: Following this screen your previously indicated handedness and gender selections will be stored and touch event recording will start. Click below to approve and continue. Approval can be revoked at any time via the Information screen.

This application gathers your touch data for research purposes while you play the following game. The target of the research is to analyse touch interaction data, in order to establish whether the data can be applied to identify generalised properties which differentiate a certain group of users from other groups. All data is anonymous.
For data labelling purposes, please indicate your gender
For data labelling purposes, please indicate your primary handedness

Click the button below to request the removal of data related to the current usage session identifier. Please note that as data is not identifiable, you will not receive a notification upon data removal.
Indicated gender and handedness \nDevice screen size and resolution \nTouch points: X and Y positions, timestamp, velocity and touch size estimation.
Touch points: X and Y positions, timestamp, velocity and touch size estimation.
The developer can be contacted at
Open source libraries used in this project

The 2048 game is an open source port of the original 2048 game created by Gabriele Cirulli. The original game can be found from the link below.

This application is created as a data-gathering platform for a Master's thesis project. The goal of this research is to establish whether it is possible to identify a user's gender and handedness based on their touch gestures. 
 
 Participation in this research is voluntary and the user can choose to not accept these terms. Data is only recorded after the user's approval. This application includes functionality with which the user can request the removal of the data associated with their current user session. 
 
 The gestures performed within this application are recorded and stored on a remote database. Gesture data is associated with the user's personal data - gender and handedness - which the user indicates on the following screens. No other information besides the user's gender and handedness are requested. Personal data is required in order to correctly categorize the recorded gestures.
 Furthermore, the user's device screen size and resolution are stored. The information inferred from the gathered data is not associated with a user nor is it permanently stored. 
 
 All the aforementioned data is associated with an anonymous, randomly generated user identifier, and as such the data cannot be related to a person. 
 
 If you have any questions or concerns about the research, please contact Matti Mäki-Kihniä for further information (matti.maki-kihnia@aalto.fi).
I agree to participate in the research
